Posts.Content: Mcquis01 wrote: Hi! I had a vacuum core biopsy completed for a Tumor found on my screening mammogram and then followed up by ultrasound which recommended a biopsy be completed due to Birad 4 classification. The biopsy came back as a benign intraductal Papilloma and was referred to a surgeon. The surgeon said it had to be removed and the biopsy is really inconclusive due to the small amount of tissue biopsied and could potentially still be found malignant. I had a lumpectomy today on my right breast. Has anyone had experience with this as well? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Intraductal Papilloma with inconclusive biopsy Mcquis01 Mcquis01

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2017 07:45PM Mcquis01 wrote: Thank you for your reply. I was beginning to think I was alone on this one. I have an appointment Thursday to go over my results with the surgeon as well. I'm still very uncomfortable after the surgery.
Posts.Title: Intraductal Papilloma with inconclusive biopsy Mcquis01 Mcquis01
